###
Question: Sarah recorded the ages of her friends at a party: \( 22 \), \( 25 \), \( 30 \), \( 20 \), and \( 28 \). Jake claims that if everyone becomes 5 years older, the range will stay the same. Lily argues that if they all share their ages equally amongst themselves, the range will change. Who do you agree with?

###
Answers:
(A) - Only Jake 

(B) - Only Lily 

(C) - Both Jake and Lily 

(D) - Neither is correct 

###
Misconceptions:
(A) - Believes if you add the same value to all numbers in the dataset the range will not change 

(B) - nan 

(C) - Believes if you add the same value to all numbers in the dataset the range will not change 

(D) - Believes that sharing ages equally will affect the highest and lowest values of the dataset 

###
Subject: Range and Interquartile Range from a List of Data
###
ConstructName: Calculate the range from a list of data
###
CorrectAnswer: A
